page.title: 14Customs of the Past (1)
page.content: During Whit-week 1985,the Winster Morris Men came one evening to perform the Taddington Morris Dance which the members of the village Oddfellows Lodge used to dance through the village on Whit-Tuesday afternoons.The men would go to church in the morning, have a sit down meal in one of the pubs and afterwards, still wearing their suits and sashes of office would take out their white handkerchiefs and dance up the village.The Club Feasts have not been held for over 50 years. When my great grandma was a little girl,over 100 years ago,children on Shrove Tuesdays used to play games like shuttlecock and battledore over the churchyard hedge.That went when the churchyard was enlarged in 1889 and the annual games seem to have died out.
